db:abstract.db:para: The QSensorGesture class represents one or more sensor gesture recognizers.
This class was introduced in Qt 5.1.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: In addition to the QSensorGesture::detected() signal, Sensor Gesture Recognizers can have their own specific signals, and may be discovered through QSensorGesture::gestureSignals().

db:para.db:emphasis: Note that QSensorGesture uses a custom meta-object in order to provide recognizer-specific signals. This means it is not possible to sub-class QSensorGesture and use Q_OBJECT. Also qobject_cast<QSensorGesture*>(ptr) will not work.

db:section.db:para: You may use QSensorGestureManager to obtain the systems known sensor gesture ids.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QSensorGesture::QSensorGesture(const QStringList &ids, QObject *parent = Q_NULLPTR)
db:section.db:para: Constructs the sensor gesture, and initializes the ids list of recognizers, with parent parent

db:section.db:title: void QSensorGesture::detected(QString gestureId)
db:section.db:para: Signals when the gestureId gesture has been recognized.

db:section.db:title: QStringList QSensorGesture::gestureSignals() const
db:section.db:para: Returns all the possible gestures signals that may be emitted.

db:section.db:title: QStringList QSensorGesture::invalidIds() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the gesture recognizer ids that were not found.

db:section.db:title: bool QSensorGesture::isActive()
db:section.db:para: Returns whether this gesture is active or not.

db:section.db:title: void QSensorGesture::startDetection()
db:section.db:para: Starts the gesture detection routines in the recognizer.

db:section.db:title: QStringList QSensorGesture::validIds() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the gesture recognizer ids that were found.
